meanings.sent1: Having the option to pick between chocolate and vanilla ice cream made me happy.
meanings.sent2: She had the option to either walk to school or take the bus.
meanings.sent3: The option to wear a clown costume to work seemed tempting but risky.
meanings.sent4: His option to quit his job and travel the world was like a door to a new adventure.
meanings.sent5: The option to study abroad opened up a world of possibilities for her future.

meanings.definition: The power or right to choose
meanings.sent1: With the option to decide on the movie, she felt empowered.
meanings.sent2: He exercised his option to select the team captain for the game.
meanings.sent3: The option to control the TV remote became a fierce battle in the living room.
meanings.sent4: Her option to vote in the election was a privilege she took seriously.
meanings.sent5: The option to make decisions for himself gave him a sense of independence.

meanings.sent1: The menu had a vegetarian option for those who preferred it.
meanings.sent2: The hotel offered an upgrade option for guests who wanted a better view.
meanings.sent3: The option to add extra toppings to the pizza made it even more delicious.
meanings.sent4: His option to buy the limited edition sneakers was a dream come true.
meanings.sent5: The option to customize her phone case allowed her to express her style.
